name: DELETE CHARACTERS
description: Use this command to delete a group of characters from an alpha field.
syntax: DELC fieldname START start NCHR number_of_characters MEM_AREA mem_area#

parameters.name: fieldname
parameters.description: The name of the alpha field.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The starting position within the field. The first character in the field is at position 1. If this value isnâ€™t specified the program will set start to the first character.

parameters.name: number_of_characters
parameters.description: The number of characters to delete from the field.

parameters.name: mem_area#
parameters.description: If you are actually deleting the characters from a memory area then this is the number (from 1-4). NOTE: Even if you want to use a memory area you must still specify a fieldname, although it will be ignored during execution of the command.

comments: This command has the same effect as though you cut out a piece of the field and put the remaining two pieces back together, filling the end of the field with spaces.
program_editor: Field -> alpha Fld cmds -> Delete chrs
